variables.label: Sonarr Version
variables.description: Check out their Docker page for the valid tags: https://hub.docker.com/r/linuxserver/sonarr/tags

variables.label: Location of all your TV Shows and Downloads
variables.description: It's best to use a single volume for downloads and TV shows. Otherwise import will take MUCH longer.

variables.label: User ID
variables.description: User ID that the process uses. Run `id <username>` on the host system to see your the UID.

variables.label: Group ID
variables.description: Group ID that the process uses. Run `id <username>` on the host system to see your the UID.

instructions.start:
üåê Website: https://sonarr.tv
üìÅ Repository: https://github.com/Sonarr/Sonarr
üëõ Donate: https://sonarr.tv/donate

Sonarr is a PVR for Usenet and BitTorrent users. It can monitor multiple RSS feeds for new episodes of your favorite shows and will grab, sort and rename them. It can also be configured to automatically upgrade the quality of files already downloaded when a better quality format becomes available.
instructions.end:
üéâüéâüéâ Successfully deployed!
Check it out at: https://$$cap_appname.$$cap_root_domain

description: A smart PVR for Usenet and BitTorrent users - Automatically downloads TV Shows for you
